intro: Glandularia perakii, commonly known as the Perak glandularia, is a flowering plant native to Malaysia. It belongs to the family Verbenaceae and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has glandular hairs on its stems and leaves, which contribute to its name and may aid in water retention. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Glandularia perakii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in supporting local insect populations.
